DataElement.preferredName: Non-Target Lesion Identification Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text code to represent disease response in a non-target lesion, using iRECIST response criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Target Lesion Identification Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention._A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.

Concepts.definition: The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.

Property.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Response
Property.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.longName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support Immunotherapy Response Protocol

ValueDomain.preferredName: Non-Targeted Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non-Complete Remission And/Or Non-Unconfirmed Progressive Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non-Complete Remission And/Or Non-Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: User curated long name to support DCI, Modified RANO, ghd, 04.24.18

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

Concepts.definition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.
